lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the element for a single-line text field.

Make sure to pick <input type="text">.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the text field display Credit Card when there's no value in it.

Make sure to pick placeholder.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a line break and create a textarea element.

Make sure to pick <br>, followed by <textarea type="text" placeholder="Your feedback">, and finally </textarea>.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the missing code to access the value of the textarea element.

Make sure to pick .value.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why do we use a function and a button to get user input from a textarea element?

Because it allows us to capture and perform an action with the user's text Because we want to display things in the consoleBecause textarea elements require it

Because it allows us to capture and perform an action with the user's text .

lessons.title: Example: Setting the display
lessons.interactiveContent:
Change the display value of the first img element to block.

Make sure to pick "block".

lessons.title: Question: Setting the color
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

It should be el.style.colorteal shouldn't be in between quotesp shouldn't be in between quotes

It should be el.style.color.

lessons.title: Example: Input Elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use JavaScript to set the input element's id to password.

Make sure to pick el followed by . and then id, =, "password", ;.

lessons.title: Example: Accessing a style
lessons.interactiveContent:
Access and display the p element's background color.

Make sure to pick el followed by . and then style, ., backgroundColor.

lessons.title: Example: Value 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Change the src attribute's value.

Make sure to pick "https://mimo.app/r/kittles.png.

lessons.title: Example: Remove a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the function so that it removes the bold class from the p element.

Make sure to pick remove followed by ( and then "bold", ).

lessons.title: Question: Add Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
Can we add multiple classes at once using classList.add(), as illustrated in the following code?

Yes, we can add multiple classes separated by commasNo, we can only add one class at a timeIt depends on how many classes the element already has

Yes, we can add multiple classes separated by commas.

lessons.title: Question: Toggle a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we use classList.toggle() to toggle the class of an element?

If the element already has the class it's removed, otherwise it's addedThe class will be added to the elementIf the element has multiple classes, they will all be replaced

If the element already has the class it's removed, otherwise it's added.

lessons.title: Question: Remove Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when this function is called?

Multiple classes are removed from the selected elementMultiple classes are toggled for the selected elementThe selected element is removed from the HTML document

Multiple classes are removed from the selected element.

lessons.title: Example: Add a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the function so that it adds the highlight class to the selected element.

Make sure to type add("highlight").
